Meaning: peak height relative to the baseline
peak area minus the baseline area
weighted average of the retention time in the peak region
weighted average of the m/z in the peak region
peak width, computed as the region where the 95 % of the peak area is distributed
peak signal-to-noise ratio, defined as the quotient between the peak height and the noise level
standard deviation of the m/z in the peak region
index that points to the ROI where the peak was detected
index that points to the Peak object in the peak attribute of the ROI
name of the sample where the feature was detected
